title: FOI: git dislikes submodules which start with '-'
body:
just noted `git status` complaining on one of shub subdatasets.  It seems (didn't check in detail) that we are ok with it (since iirc we do parsing of .gitmodules ourselves) but git whines/does not consider them:

```
$> datalad create -d . -- -udunits2-devel-
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/testds/-udunits2-devel- 
[INFO   ] Scanning for unlocked files (this may take some time) 
add(ok): -udunits2-devel- (file)                                                                          
add(ok): .gitmodules (file)                                                                               
save(ok): . (dataset)
create(ok): -udunits2-devel- (dataset)
action summary:
  add (ok: 2)
  create (ok: 1)
  save (ok: 1)

$> datalad subdatasets
subdataset(ok): -mine2 (dataset)
subdataset(ok): -udunits2-devel- (dataset)
action summary:
  subdataset (ok: 2)

$> git submodule
warning: ignoring 'submodule.-mine2.path' which may be interpreted as a command-line option: -mine2
warning: ignoring 'submodule.-udunits2-devel-.path' which may be interpreted as a command-line option: -udunits2-devel-
fatal: no submodule mapping found in .gitmodules for path '-mine2'

$> git status
warning: ignoring 'submodule.-mine2.path' which may be interpreted as a command-line option: -mine2
warning: ignoring 'submodule.-udunits2-devel-.path' which may be interpreted as a command-line option: -udunits2-devel-
On branch master
```

so something to possibly keep in mind, or even prevent (if we say that users should be able to use datalad-produced stuff even if datalad goes away)
